meanings.definition: Outsins (verb): to surpass or exceed in sinfulness
meanings.sent1: She always tries to outsins her sister in misbehaving.
meanings.sent2: He outsins all his friends when it comes to breaking the rules.
meanings.sent3: The naughty puppy managed to outsins the older dog in causing trouble.
meanings.sent4: His actions outsins any other student in the school.
meanings.sent5: The villain in the movie outsins all others in wickedness.

meanings.definition: Outsins (adjective): more sinful or wicked than others
meanings.sent1: The criminal's behavior was the most outsins in the entire town.
meanings.sent2: She had the most outsins reputation among her peers.
meanings.sent3: The haunted house had an outsins atmosphere that sent shivers down your spine.
meanings.sent4: The outsins character in the story was truly despicable.
meanings.sent5: The outsins act of betrayal left everyone shocked.

meanings.definition: Outsins (noun): acts or instances of sinning beyond what is considered normal or acceptable
meanings.sent1: The priest was troubled by the outsins he witnessed in the community.
meanings.sent2: The book detailed the outsins of a notorious criminal.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show exaggerated the outsins of the characters for laughs.
meanings.sent4: The news report highlighted the outsins committed by the corrupt officials.
meanings.sent5: The painting depicted the outsins of humanity in a powerful way.
